job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Site Reliability Engineer</p><p><strong>Duration:</strong> 4 Months contract to hire</p><p><strong>Location:</strong> Remote</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Candidates who were SRE backgrounds with CI/CD focus</strong></p><ul><li><span>Going with an SLA, SLI, SLO approach where they talk about reliability</span></li><li>1 SRE to every 2-3 areas (1 in 25-30)</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Skills:</strong></p><ul><li>Windows/Linux servers--on-prem legacy hardware/infrastructure/servers</li><li>Cloud--preferred (Azure ideally)</li><li>Network equipment (Cisco)</li><li>Knowing the difference between observability and monitoring</li><li>Observability: understand state of service/overall health of the system&nbsp;</li><li>Monitoring: specific to this specific component of this server</li><li>Scripting helpful, but don’t need a coder--they identify areas of improvement/do scripting for integrations into Splunk, but that's handled by higher level people on team</li></ul>
